body.name: Unipows Ergonomic Vertical Mouse, Wireless Type C Rechargeable Mouse with USB & Type C Adapter, Silent Small Mouse for Notebook, Laptop, Desktop, PC, MacBook and All Type C Devices - Pink
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 1 hr 15 mins
features: 【IMPORTANT NOTE】This ergonomic mouse is recommended for small to medium hands, as the size of the mouse is 10.7 x 7.4 x 7.1 CM ( 4.2 x 2.9 x 2.8 inch). To get a more comfortable fit and better user experience, we recommend measuring the size of your hand prior to purchasing.

【Vertical Ergonomic Mouse】This ergonomic mouse features a 60°vertical angle for a comfortable palm grip, along with vertical stripes to prevent slipping. Its ergonomic design aims to minimize wrist and arm fatigue, while improving posture during mouse usage.

【Type C Adapter & 2.4G USB Connection】Type C wireless mouse supports 2.4G and Type C wireless connections. Compatible with Mac OS, Windows, iPad OS, Android systems and iPhone15/iPhone15plus/iPhone 15pro/iphone 15 pro max. It works with laptops, desktops, tablets, smartphones, game consoles, and devices with a Type C interface like monitors, projectors, and TVs. (Note: Type C adapter included in the package, please remember to take it out.)

【Noiseless Clicking with No Sounds】The mouse is very quiet, suitable for office or nighttime use without disturbing others. It has a 500Hz polling rate for faster response and reduced input delay. The low-noise buttons and silent scroll wheel provide a quiet and comfortable experience, helping you focus on your work.

【Rechargeable & Power Saving】This mouse has a 500mAh built-in lithium battery. The indicator light turns green when fully charged in 2 hours. With a full charge, it can be used for 2 months (based on 8 hours of daily use). The small hands mouse has a 3-second first-level sleep mode and a 1-minute second-level sleep mode for low power consumption and energy-saving design.

【Colorful pink Pretty Mouse】A pink mouse with a compact and exquisite design adds vibrancy to your workspace, stimulating creativity and fostering a positive mindset. Its beauty creates a relaxed and pleasant atmosphere throughout the workday, making it an ideal gift choice.

【Compact & Responsive Mouse】This mouse provides precise positioning, convenience, quiet operation, compact design, excellent tactile feedback, and superior quality. The left-side buttons enable easy webpage navigation, while the Boss button allows for one-click return to the desktop (Windows) or multitasking page (Mac OS).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Budget Lift knock off feals good.
reviews.reviewText: This mouse, Unipows Ergonomic Vertical Mouse, MBD7, is a knock off of the Logitech Lift Mouse. The Logitech MX vertical mouse is the standard for this type of mouse. The MX vertical has high quality and high price. But the MX vertical is also very large, good for a dedicated desk, but not great for anything else. So the Logitech Lift mouse was introduced, a smaller vertical mouse to fill the gap, and a lower price. The problem with the Lift mouse is that it feels cheap compared to the MX vertical and the price difference is not enough to justify it. That’s why I wanted to try Unipows Ergonomic Vertical Mouse, MBD7, at its reasonable mouse price point. The listing page did not have much details about the mouse, so it was a bit of a gamble. But so far, this mouse has been a good deal.Features: DPI setting: 800, 1200,1600, 2400 Buttons: Left, Middle, Right, Page Up, Page Down, Close Window, & DPI SettingThe mouse feels sturdier than the Lift. The materials are all hard plastic except for the rubber scroll wheel. The MBD7 otherwise feels similar to the Lift. The mouse sensor tracks well on non ideal surfaces, like a bean bag chair, which most mouse sensors do not track well or at all.Not a big fan of rechargeable batteries in mouses as they seem to always fail, I will update my review is I encounter any issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Overall great mouse for the price
reviews.reviewText: Wanted to try an ergonomic mouse that didn't break the bank. This mouse is very comfortable and smooth. The only reason that I didn't give it 5 stars is because it is not as quiet as they make it seem. The left clicker is quite loud compared to the right. Other than that, you can't beat the quality for the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars for a smaller hand
reviews.reviewText: I believe I have average size hands for a lady and it fits perfectly to my hand. A man's hand would be too large for it. It is comfortable and glides easily. The response time is good for general computer use. I would not say it is good for gaming responses. Overall a good product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I've been wanting to try an ergonomic vertical mouse for a while now and this one is perfect. And pink, too!I use my mouse a lot for graphic work, and after working for long periods of time my wrist and pinky finger gets sore (I know that sounds weird, but its something about how my pinky rubs against the mouse when using it.)Using this mouse immediately feels comfortable and natural in your hand. Your holding your wrist, hand, and arm in a much more natural position. It does take a moment to get used to the movements of this mouse, and I had to change the mouse speed setting on my computer until it felt right, however, the buttons and roller are intuitive and the same as a regular mouse.It feels a little awkward when doing a lot of detail work with this mouse, but that may be because I'm still getting used to the new shape.The buttons are very quiet, and I like that it's rechargeable by USB C and it comes with an usb to usb C adapter and charging cable. Overall this is a really quality mouse. The buttons are smooth and quiet, and the mouse moves smoothly over my mouse pad. Well done!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I like it, I think…..
reviews.reviewText: I am still a bit undecided on this mouse. I have not used a vertical mouse before. It takes a little getting used to. Different muscle memory for your hand and fingers.The bottom part of my hand is sore and red, almost need a pad for my hand and wrist to rest on now.So it is cool and works well. I like that it can be charged and that it is pink. Time will tell if I love it though or if I return to the standard mouse.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best of Show in functional design - but optimized for Windows environment.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. More like a moving joystick, clearly it's thinking outside the box which allows the user to keep the wrist and "firing" buttons in a vertical position. A red led flash gives an indication of the mouse's DPI (dots per inch) setting. The mouse has an on/off switch that is colored red and green and leaves no doubt whether the mouse needs charging or it's turned off.The so called "boss' button minimizes all open windows and leaves only the desktop showing. Another press of the button will re-store the desktop as it was. This button's function only applies to a Windows environment. It does take some "mindfulness" to adapt to the new ergonomics and the 'boss' button can get in the way when lifting the mouse of the surface.The site has an AI product support bot, very nicely done - though it failed to answer a simple question on how to check the DPI state. The MDB7 vertical mouse comes with a nicely printed user guide and a USB-C to USB A adapter to connect the mouse USB receiver if not using a type A port.Mac / Android platforms cannot make use of the fwd / backward / boss buttons. It does take some hand re-training to make use of them in the Wndows environment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This mouse is the perfect size for me (I have smaller hands than most) and the color is very cute. My only complaint is the mouse isn’t quite responsive enough to my liking. I do appreciate that it comes with a usb to usbc adapter for it to charge. Overall this is cute for the aesthetic, but again, not touchy enough for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great for small hands
reviews.reviewText: Very comfortable in a small hand. Like most optic mice be sure to not use it on a white reflective surface. I loved how it allowed my hand to rest and still move the mouse easily.
